section.title: Introduction
section.p: An AccessController has the responsibility to authenticate clients and to authorize requests.

section.title: Default Access Controller
section.p: The DefaultAccessController combines an Authenticator, a set of Authorizers, an AccreditableManager and a PolicyManager to perform these tasks.

section.title: Bypassable Access Controller
section.p: The BypassableAccessController is a DefaultAccessController that can be bypassed for certain URL patterns. For URLs that match those patterns (regular expressions), access is granted for free.

section.title: Customizing Access Control

p.strong: How can I store my users in a database?

section.p: You have to implement a UserManager wich accesses the database to obtain the user information. Additionally, you have to implement an AccreditableManager which uses this UserManager. This AccreditableManager has to be declared in cocoon.xconf and assigned to your AccessController in lenya/pubs/mypub/config/ac/ac.xconf.
